exclusion_reason: Only able to obtain abstract. We assumed this study was uncontrolled. The authors claimed that in 200 unselected psoriasis participants treated with phenoxymethylpenicillin, excellent responses were observed in guttate psoriasis (80% complete clearance), good responses in acute exacerbation of chronic psoriasis (50% clearance), and poor in chronic plaque psoriasis (10% clearance).
